location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Charles Bean Euan-Smith, Aden, to Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the journey to and arrival at Aden prior to Euan-Smith and family's onward journey; the Political Resident for Aden, John William Schneider, greeting them there and the news of Pelly's new appointment.The letter also discusses the final report (from the Zanzibar anti-slavery mission) which Sir Bartle is completing; the Turks causing Schneider a great deal of anxiety in Aden and news of the death of the Nabib of Makaleh and that the Nabib's son has submitted the confirmation of his father's anti-slavery engagement.The letter concludes by reporting when Smith expects to be in England, his correspondence address once there and a letter Sir Bartle Frere has received from Lord Northbrook.
